questions.question: Vector file sizes are usually smaller than raster data. Say True or False

explanations.a: Correct Answer.Vector file sizes are usually smaller than raster data.
explanations.b: Vector file sizes are usually smaller than raster data.

questions.question: Which statement about Vector data is False

answers.a: Require more storage space than raster data
answers.b: Easier to register, scale, and re-project

explanations.a: Correct Answer. Vector file sizes are usually smaller in size and requires less storage.
explanations.b: Vector data is Easier to register, scale, and re-project
explanations.c: Vector data is Simpler to update and maintain
explanations.d: Vector data is Compatible with relational database environments

questions.question: Which of the following is Digitizing Errors in GIS

explanations.a: Dangles,Overshoots and Undershoots and Slivers are Digitizing Errors in GIS.
explanations.b: Dangles,Overshoots and Undershoots and Slivers are Digitizing Errors in GIS.
explanations.c: Dangles,Overshoots and Undershoots and Slivers are Digitizing Errors in GIS.
explanations.d: Correct Answers. Dangles,Overshoots and Undershoots and Slivers are Digitizing Errors in GIS.

explanations.c: Correct Answer. Heads-up digitization is On-screen digitization

answers.b: Coordinate reference system (CRS) and Other attributes

explanations.a: Metadata has Extent & Object type and the Coordinate reference system.
explanations.b: Metadata has Extent & Object type and the Coordinate reference system.
explanations.c: Metadata has Extent & Object type and the Coordinate reference system.
explanations.d: Correct Answers. Metadata has Extent & Object type and the Coordinate reference system.
